title.narrative: Meso level: Strong Southern Women's Rights Organizations advancing women's rights and gender equality

Note: the actual value include #25 regular and #2 special grants

location.ref: During the COVID-19 context, more organizations have focused primarily on online contacts, webinars, and online meetings. This means that there was much more cooperation with other organizations/institutions such as governments - local, national, regional, - universities, other NGOs, etc. It should also be noted in since 2020, that FIMI strengthened the process of accompaniment to partners and this improved not only the implementation of projects but also the reporting and monitoring. .

title.narrative: Micro level: More women exercise their leadership to promote women rights and gender equality

description.narrative: Women and girls who are actively promoting/advancing women´s rights and gender equality with various stakeholders (state actors, NGOs and CSOs, traditional leaders, religious institutions, private sector, academia, media, etc). Categories: 1) Holding positions in institutions in different levels (formal or informal). 2) Actively engaged in dialogues with different stakeholders (formal or informal). Subject: Grantees´beneficiaries (girls and women participating on the activities implemented by the grantees).

Holding positions in institutions in different levels (formal).

comment.narrative: Only women and girls who are actively promoting/advancing women´s rights and gender equality with various stakeholders are counted. However, it is necessary to bear in mind as well that there are 19.782 women, men and community members that engaged with awareness raising; 7.034 who attended the trainings (5252 women and 1782 men); and 320 (governmental officials).

comment.narrative: The identified women and girls who are actively promoting/advancing women´s rights and gender equality with various stakeholders are the women Actively engaged in dialogues with different stakeholders (formal or informal) in the UN Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues (18th Session) held in April 2019 in New York. These leaders were the representatives from the different partner organizations from Asia and Africa (grantees 2018-2019) selected to attend the UNPFII, the Wold Bank Side Event and the Global School of Leadership from FIMI. The thematic priorit y was connected to the indigenous languages. More information on the follow up of this indicator will be provided by December 1st, 2019 since mid-term reports and results have to be processed by that time with the updates.

Indigenous women women and girls who are actively promoting/advancing women´s rights and gender equality with various stakeholders (state actors, NGOs and CSOs, traditional leaders, religious institutions, private sector, academia, media, etc). Categories: 1 indigenous women holding positions in institutions in different levels (formal). 1556 indigenous women actively engaged in dialogues with different stakeholders (formal or informal). Subject: Grantees´beneficiaries (girls and women participatin on the activities implemented by the grantees). Aprobado.

location.ref: In the context of COVID-19, many organizations have run campaigns, organized information meetings and, in some cases, house-to-house visits. This is particularly the case of African partners. It should also be noted in since 2020, that FIMI strengthened the process of accompaniment to partners and this improved not only the implementation of projects but also the reporting and monitoring.

title.narrative: Macro level: Improved pre-conditions / enabling environment for women’s rights and gender equality

description.narrative: umber of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality.

title.narrative: Number of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality.

description.narrative: Positive changes (adoption of new perconditions, blocking of negative ones, improvement of existing ones, implementation of existing ones) in pre conditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, by type of changes (5 domains of change): 1.Change in control. 2.Changes in values and norms. 3.Changes in actions. 4.Changes in association. 5.Changes in resource allocations. Categories: 1) Processes towards positive change; 2) Actual change. Subject: Only direct beneficiaries (grantees)

comment.narrative: Number of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, focused on the individual and collective rights of indigenous women.
Number of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, focused on the individual and collective rights of indigenous women.

location.ref: This includes LAC results that closed their project implementation after the 2019 annual report (18 projects) In addition, the second call included 45 projects (almost half of the total number of projects), including 15 large organizations.

comment.narrative: Number of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, focused on the individual and collective rights of indigenous women.

Number of positive changes in preconditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, focused on the individual and collective rights of indigenous women.

Positive changes (adoption of new perconditions, blocking of negative ones, improvement of existing ones, implementation of existing ones) in pre conditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality, by type of changes (5 domains of change): 1.Change in control. 2.Changes in values and norms. 3.Changes in actions. 4.Changes in association. 5.Changes in resource allocations. Subject: Only direct beneficiaries (grantees). Note to the consultant: importance of defining each domain in accordance with the "Thematic Reporting Guidelines for Women´s Rights and Gender Equality".

Positive changes (adoption of new perconditions, blocking of negative ones, improvement of existing ones, implementation of existing ones) in pre conditions for enabling environment for advancing women's rights and gender equality for indigenous women. In a ccordance to the most recent update, we were able to identified 18 positive changes (5 originally assessed and reported to MFA by May 31,2019) and 13 new positive changes identified throughout the processing of new partner's data (partner organizations 2018-2019, 15 out of 25 reports processed).
